editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The gameâ€™s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TVâ€”we feel like weâ€™re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

ios.subtitle: Take It To The Next Level

editorialNotes.standard: Developer Jan Ilavsky came up with the idea for this gorgeous Apple Design Award winner after heâ€™d broken his arm. He started on an infinite runner that could be played one-handed, and since heâ€™s also colorblind, he added a gameplay element about changing between vibrant neon colors. Chameleon Run succeeds beautifully, balancing wicked speed with irresistible, just-one-more-try challenges.
editorialNotes.short: You'll need quick reactions in this intense polychromatic platformer.

editorialNotes.standard: A talking goat ate your grimoire! Relearn recipes by collecting reagents and tricking folks in this bewitchingly fun fairy tale.

So much more than a simple action game, Duet elevates the act of dodging falling blocks into something captivating, beautiful, even profound. A stirring soundtrack and striking visuals almost guarantee youâ€™ll lose yourself in each stage, and as you learn the patterns and find yourself avoiding obstacles by sheer instinct, youâ€™ll feel an overwhelming surge of triumph.
editorialNotes.short: Two vessels play out lifeâ€™s duality.

editorialNotes.standard: With relaxed swapping rules and charming graphics, this surprisingly slick match-3 puzzler makes the genre feel fresh again.

This clever physics-based puzzle game challenges you to spray water to extinguish fires and manipulate the environment. Its simple, clearly defined mechanics allow for intuitive, satisfying puzzle-solving. New elements are routinely layered in, ensuring that the challenges stay interesting. Great visuals and impressive sound also set Sprinkle Islands apart.

Ski Safari returns with an all-new look and the same addicting gameplay. Now you can hit the slopes as Sven's sister, Evana, boot up with a snowboard, and unlock all sorts of new power-ups. To outrun an impending avalanche youâ€™ll need to crash through cabins, team up with Yetis and eagles, and perform tons of tricks. The gameplay is as fast-paced as ever, and a fresh multiplayer mode and colorful new worlds to explore (like a prehistoric volcano) will keep you cruising down these mountains for a long time.

This spectacular collection by Zen Studios, the Jedi masters of virtual pinball, brings the Star Wars saga to life like youâ€™ve never seen it before. Based on the films, TV shows, and even iconic characters, each dazzlingly detailed game plays like a true labor of love. Beyond the brilliant table designs, the flawless physics faithfully recreate the mechanics of real pinball with stunning sights and sounds straight out of a galaxy far, far away.

name: Willy's Wonderland
artistName: QUByte Games Desenvolvimento de Jogos LTDA

editorialNotes.standard: One of the App Storeâ€™s early sensations, Doodle Jump HD has only improved with age. The superbly simple gameplay remains: tilt your device to hop up an endless series of platforms, blasting bad guys, grabbing power-ups, and making your mark on a global leaderboard. Hand-drawn visuals add quirky appeal, while an evolving mix of doodled worlds, special items, and whimsical characters keep this indie classic fresh.
